name: 許益瑞
objective:
Interpretation chemical reaction is one of the important topics in physical chemistry. In this course, we will focus on (i) statistical thermodynamics and (ii) chemical kinetics. The basic idea is how to study and to interpret chemical reaction from microscopic point of quantum chemistry to macroscopic point of thermodynamics. Here, statistical thermodynamics provides the link between the microscopic properties of matter and its bulk properties. Then, the rates of chemical reactions and reaction mechanisms will be discussed. Finally, the transition state theory inspires a thermodynamic approach to reaction rates will be applied to discuss the chemical reaction.
Outline :
The course will include the following main topics :
1.	Statistical thermodynamics 1: the concepts
2.	Statistical thermodynamics 2: applications
3.	Molecules in motion- Kinetic Theory of Gases
4.	The rates of chemical reactions
5.	Reaction dynamics

Week 4: 	Ensemble and Molecular Partition Functions (II)
Week 5:	Statistical Thermodynamics (I)

Week 7:	Kinetic Theory of Gases(I)
Week 8:	Kinetic Theory of Gases(II)
Week 9:	Midterm

Week 11:	Elementary Chemical Kinetics (II)
Week 12:	Transition State Theory (I)
Week 13:	Transition State Theory (II)
Week 14:	The dynamics of molecular collisions (I)
Week 15:	The dynamics of molecular collisions (II)
Week 16:	The dynamic of electron transfer (I)
Week 17:	The dynamic of electron transfer (II)
Week 18:	Final exam.
